Reviews.Title: “Good location, modestly priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love-to-World-Travel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is 2 1/2 to 3-stars. The rooms are typically European-style (quite small), ensuite bathroom (also very small). The rooms were clean. The decor is pleasant, but the walls are exceedingly thin. We could hear casual conversations and coughing from another room. We were there in April 2012; the weather was warm with cool nights, but the temperature in the room was very hot. Opening a window was insufficient to cool it down, and the hotel was unable to provide us with a fan. The beds are very hard, not at all comfortable - unless you like that sort of thing. Be sure to ask for a queen or king bed if you are a couple. We initially got two twin beds. The front desk moved us the next night to a room with a queen. Breakfast is included in their fares and the meal is ample. The location is very close to the tram stop or a km+ walk to the main touristic attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: OliMonaco
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, confortable rooms but small bathrooms. Staff not very friendly at the reception. Good breakfast buffet but their staff didn't clean the tables between 2 different customers. I ordered airport transfer at their reception but in the morning they told me that I had to pay the driver in cash which I wanted to avoid. The driver asked me shorty before arriving at the airport to pay him as he might get in trouble with the police at the airport ?!? Good location if you want to be close to the Grand Bazaar. 15 mn walk to Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AC81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four days and from the moment we walked in the nightmare began. First, we walked in and we were not greeted by anyone at all. We walked up to front desk to check in and the girl at the front desk ( Neriman was her name) and again she didn't greet, her first words to us were "passports". My husband handed her his passport and credit card and her response was, I didn't ask you for a credit card. Her tone was rude and condescending to say the least. When booking reservation, we indicated that we were arriving at noon and would need an early checkin. They had our reservation completely wrong, not only did they want us to wait two hours for room but they also didn't have the room we requested available. We had two rooms reserved, one for myself, my husband and two children (ages 2 and 4) and one room for my in-laws. The room that was intended for myself, husband and kids was the one not available and they wanted us to take a room with two single beds (twin size beds). The manager was very nonchalant and rude and basically said that is what is was and we could take it or leave it. My husband was furious and ended up having an arguement with front desk manager. After contacting our travel agency and hotel manager they apologized and immediately upgraded us to a suite. The room and hotel itself was nicely decorated and very cool for the historical aspects within the actual facility but the customer service was nonexistent. So with the check-in behind us, we get to the room which was spacious and clean however the room was so HOT! Apparently there is central heat and air but it is controlled by the front office and they were running the heat. The day we arrived it was 18 degrees celcius (about 64 farenheit) The thermometer in the hallway read 29 degrees celcius (84 farenheit) so I can only imagine what our actual room temperature was! When we asked if there was any way to just stop the heat, not even turn ac on just turn heat off and their response to us was "what if someone is cold" Not wanting to argue, we just left it alone but we were miserable! For the first time in my kids lives they had to sleep stark naked and with windows wide open. Because of where our room sat, we were in between four walls so there was NO air what so ever blowing into our rooms and we were right under restaurant so with windows open, not only did we have heat issues but we had to deal with dishes and silverware being washed and put away in the wee hours of the morning, on Sunday night til almost 4am in the morning! My kids developed heat rashes on their backs and necks and I was so hot that I got nauseous and sick one morning. My family and I travel quite often and we have never been so uncomfortable in any hotel like this ever. The unwillingness of hotel staff to try to accommodate us and the uncomfortable temperature made our stay miserable. This was our second time in Istanbul and we would never ever recommend this hotel to anyone, in fact, had we not booked thru a travel agency and all expenses already paid, we would have left and stayed somewhere else. The only decent treatment we received was from the cleaning crew, the bellhop and restaurant staff. Front desk staff and managers are a joke and we have spoken to our travel agent to never recommend this hotel to any of their customers again. This place was not worth the money or the aggravation! The only positive thing I can say about this hotel is that the location was very good. Close to Grand Bazar and not a far walk by foot to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi, Hia Sophia and good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “well run hotel”
Reviews.Author: vincenzo s
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last week. The position is great especially if you want shopping at the Gran Bazar, also is very close to the tram stop, very easy to sightseeing. Rooms are very cleaned and the breakfast is plenty of veriety of food. Staff in the breakfast room and the chambermaid ( from Bulgaria ) are very nice, at the desk there is only one girl with blond hair who is profesional and helpful the rest of the receptionists could be more kind. There is the wi-fi connection and two computer and a printer available in the lobby for the guests.I suggest also to eat there. I tried their restaurant for lunch in a rainy day and I found it very great, food is fresh and good and the service is great.

Reviews.Title: “We highly recommend it-family from Canada”
Reviews.Author: catherine p
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Antik hotel in July 2011 . We were 2 adult 2 children ( 13 and 16). ROOM: We made reservation based on the pictures we saw on the net. We asked for the "red suite". I don,t know about the other room but if you ask for the "red suite" you won't be disapointed We travel very often and like confort and cleanliness. When got in the room, we were really surprised. The room was bigger and nicer than the pictures with 2 bathroom and 2 TV. Our bed was in separated part of the room than the children. (No ddor between ) It worth the price. Everything was bright new and and shiny: the linen, the wooden floor, the bathroom floor and walls... We could see ourselves through the white bathroom tiles. STAFF: Nice, with a smile and helpfull to give some tips and info. FOOD: Breakfeast was generous and excellent in a bright modern dining room. We had only 1 souper there. Very good, exellent service. But the place was empty. People prefer to go in the city. AREA You can walk in the area ( nice little boutiks" but not that much restaurant. 15 minutes walk to the Bazar. It's located about 15 minutes "tramway" of Sultanamet . We appreciate being out of the Sultanamet area : it was more quiet and it gives you a chance to be with the local people. We walk until 11PM and felt safe because it was very busy. I would go back there anytime

Reviews.Title: “Very affordable and good location for Sultanahmet”
Reviews.Author: avdij
Reviews.Content: This small and rather old hotel has a good location for visiting Aya Sofia, the Blue Mosque and nearby attactions. Buffet style breakfast. I was staying in the annex just around the corner, which was at times quite noisy, the rooms in the hotel proper looked much better. Service was very helpful and language was no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Generally Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: b00kw0rm88
Reviews.Content: The location and facilities offered at the Antik Hotel are really first-rate. I was disappointed by the front office staff, however, who were cold, distant, unknowledgeable and unfriendly. The heat was on in the rooms to an uncomfortable level and the thermostat did not allow us to adjust it. We had a nice view from our window though and the breakfasts were excellent. We tried the restaurant for dinner though and were rather disappointed when in two separate cases, the meal we received was not what was presented in the menu (spinach salad without spinach, chicken and asparagus with no asparagus).

Reviews.Title: “didn t like”
Reviews.Author: hotel_lorena_firenze
Reviews.Content: Me and My boyfriend we staied there 4 days on January. The hotel was not full at all but they gave us a very little room and noisy. The pillows were uncomfortable and in the morning the light enter from the window I also asked them to send a post card and I paied there 3 EURO. The lady with a big smile say ok no problem. The post card never arrived. No words

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaMaria05
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Antik Hotel. It was in a great location. We had a nice big room and the restaurant upstairs was a good option if you did not feel like going out. I would recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not such a great staaf”
Reviews.Author: Katerina H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in walking distantion from Hagia Sofia, Top Capi Palace and other Istanbul's highlights. Room was beautiful, spaceful and cleen. There were only three things we didn't like about hotel: 1) all hotel staaf (aspecially at front desk and in restaurant) were very slow and not nice. 2) poor breakfast fast same ever day. Coffe was really awful and artificial fruit juices weren't drinkable. 3) it was quite noisy at night in our room because of some works on street (started at 7 PM).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Wayfarer_1953
Reviews.Content: Very near to the main street for taxis and Tram, Grand Bazar was near by. No need of walking uphill compared to the other hotels in the vicinity. Break fast was just OK, Rooms were clean. The staff were very polite and spoke good Eglish, Wetayed for five nights, they could arrange for transport a few times and that was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maravas
Reviews.Content: From 2006 we visited this hotel every year. This year weÂ´re here for the 6th time. It is has good accomodation and location in the middle of Beyazit-Istanbul. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. For visiting the city - nearby the Grand Bazar and a tramway-stop and off course for shopping - It is s a very good location. We certainly come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management, super tiny rooms, and no A/C during the day”
Reviews.Author: timesarr0w
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel during the summer months. They only run their air-conditioning in the evening and early morning. (They turn it off at 11am turn it on at 5pm, and then turn it off again while you are sleeping.) The management is also poor. They charged our credit cards for our stay at check -in when they said they were just testing to see if it worked. They also tried to charge us for nights that we weren't there for, etc. While checking out (an almost hour long process) and irate customer was also at the desk. Apparently, they took his reservation and then didn't have a room when he showed up. I do NOT recommend this hotel. There are plenty of better hotels to chose from in Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “nice and friendly”
Reviews.Author: scuzzi
Reviews.Content: just been to this hotel in Istanbul. Apart from some troubles the first night, I had a really nice experience: friendly staff, quite large rooms, bathtub, and nice breakfast on the top floor with a lovely view over the sea. Also, they addressed the first night trouble (overbooked) very nicely and I had been offered a free meal and a plate of fruit. Maybe the area in the direct surroundings is not thrilling, but it is 5 min walk from the grand bazar and 15 min from the Blue mosque area!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Welcome to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ann6191
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Turkey for the first time and travelling solo for 5 days till I met up with family. While solo, I had the pleasure of staying here for 3 nights and had a day room for one day. The accommodation was on 3 different sets of dates. I am a regular traveller and work in the service industry, and while I don't really care to stay in a 5 Star establishment, I do expect certain things of a hotel: Cleanliness, Security, Location, Friendliness ( - and preferably with staff who speak English). The Antik Hotel ticked all the above boxes. And came with some bonuses!- lovely hot and cold buffet breakfast served on the rooftop with lots of sunlight and ocean views; the room was quiet and peaceful. This is probably attributed to the fact that the hotel, although loacted within a 5 minute walk of the Grand Bazaar, is tucked neatly into a peaceful side street just off the main road. The rooms on all the 3 occasions I was there were very clean. If I see hair or mould, it really does leave me miserable. None of that here. And no musty smell. The beds were nice and firm, sheets on them were very well pressed and very white in colour. And the decor of my room - very fresh, and light colours ( white/citrus yellow-green -mustard hues). I'm not sure about the the decor of the other rooms on the other floors, but I was on the first floor. The staff were very friendly and helpful; Zumir (Spelling?) the hotel manager was very helpful in connecting me to an excellent tour agency who handled my excursions out of Istanbul and helpful in every other way during my stay there. The housekeepers were lovely, bringing up an iron with a nice smile everytime I asked for an iron. There was one occassion when the housekeepers had gone home, but I was still brought an iron to my room by someone else. The doormen and waiting staff were also very helpful and lovely. All the staff spoke English well. I have heard of certain hotels in Istanbul where security is an issue eg. where someone knocks on your door wanting to sell you things etc...As I was a girl travelling solo, I was particular about this aspect and would highly recommend this hotel to any girl travelling on her own. What else can I say except that I don't usually write reviews but this hotel impressed me. It is good value. I booked my hotel upon arrival at Attaturk airport and the person whom i booked my room through over the phone was extremely helpful and informative. The hotel was a lovely first impression of Turkey, which by the way is just the best place to visit!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Shareen020
Reviews.Content: We're not too fussy when it comes to hotels as long as it's clean, tidy, and looks ok, I'm happy. I was so pleased with the Antik I was shocked at how much I enjoyed my stay! The rooms Aren't the biggest, but they are clean! As with every hotel they must have off days, but durring the week I stayed here with my husband we really enjoyed it. The breakfast, and dinner was delicious! And the friendliest people we inncounted throughout our trip were from this hotel!! The location is fantastic!! It's close to some of the top tourist attractions, such as the grand bazaar, (5 minutes walk ) blue mosque, araasta bazaar, and hagia sofia, all a 15 minutes walk away, and its a 25 minute walk from topkapi palace! (which is close to the shore) As long as your not expecting a huge suite, I think you'll enjoy it. :)

Reviews.Title: “A well run hotel in a great location with a helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: sandiegoeater749
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel in May 2011. We were pleased with the facility and their very helpful and friendly staff. The hotel is comparable to nice European hotels in this price range, as to the quality of the facility and the level of service. We were very pleased with our room; we stayed in a corner suite. The hotel provides a very generous breakfast buffet with eggs, juices, many different types of bread and rolls, with accompanying jellies and jams, fresh yogurts, fruit, tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, cheeses, sliced meats, tea and coffee and more, with some variety daily. The hotels is in a great location for visiting the historical sites, located near the Beyazit tramway stop. We took the tramway everywhere. The staff was very helpful with directions, making reservations and suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “It is a nice place to stay at Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: Gandylin
Reviews.Content: This is the first time to be Istanbul, once we arrival we have pick up by the hotel car and bring to the wrong room, then I go to the front desk and ask for the room exchange. The manager immidately upgrade me to the deluxe room, we are very appreciateï¼�

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: p_h11
Reviews.Content: overall the the experience was good, however found their billing system a bit confusing as it showed different rated to the reservation, this was resolved by the duty manager. Also with hind site we would not have booked the "Panoramic Dinner" via the internet as it was nothing special. We were given the normal restaurant menu's and found that we could of eaten cheaper if we wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “If you are thinking about staying in the Old Town the Antik Hotel is definitely a good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Germantraveller2011
Reviews.Content: The staff of the Antik Hotel is nice and helpful no matter what the issue is. The breakfast is good and changes every day and the Internet is free in all areas. The style of the hotel is as its name suggests charming and romantic. There are two restaurants in the Hotel and in one of the restaurants there are artifacts which were found during building activities. In Turkey I would in general suggest a 4* Hotel. The rooms are 4* standard. The tramway is in walking distance as is the Grand Bazar and also the other sights such as the Hagia Sophia are close.

Reviews.Title: “this trip was unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: LilianOk
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel because it is clean, comfortable, nice bathroom, good breakfast and easy to get around to the tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “it is good”
Reviews.Author: pirouzpey
Reviews.Content: Breakfast and cleaning rooms and reception Giving good service

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel in a nice position”
Reviews.Author: espertone
Reviews.Content: a good hotel in a good position. the terrace has a good view. it's difficult to obtain the room you want (we asked for a suite at the 4th floor and we obtained a suite at the 1st floor). good service. clean and quiet hotel. beautiful restaurant in the caverna.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: ranissima
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Antik Hotel for 4 nights end of April with my husband. This hotel is "the" perfect location to visit all of the Old part of Istanbul. Everything was in a walking distance. The room was small but good and clean. the breakfast was great too. Although, one afternoon we were resting in our room after a long day of walking and other guests were slamming their rooms' door so loudly! i didnt complain to the staff since i didnt think it would have made any difference. Apart from that i would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, very friendly, very good with children, great room”
Reviews.Author: BirregurraBoy
Reviews.Content: After reading the previous reviews of this hotel we were a bit worried, but we were pleasantly surprised. The family room was great (non-smoking as requested), two bathrooms, tv and plenty of room. The restaurant was great and they went out of their way to please the children (3 and 6). Ignore the comments about the restaurant being in the basement as it is actually a Roman cisterne (which you will queue and pay money to see elsewhere). Location is good. Easy walk to the Grand Bazaar, aqueduct and Suleiman Mosque. Easy walk to tram stop, 2 stops from city centre. Good collection of local shops nearby that allowed easy purchase of little extras needed for children. Very happy and would recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “very small rooms, but good location”
Reviews.Author: Evgenia_87
Reviews.Content: Our room in hotel was very tiny and old-fashioned, we scarcely could find enough space to walk between the bed and wall. The hotel is located in the side-street next to the University, in 10 minutes walking to the old city centre and 15 minutes going down to the shore. Do not count that you will have any view from the windows, but if you are not going to spend most time inside the hotel it could be not so bad variant for a short stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, fairly noisy on back street”
Reviews.Author: BC96
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Antik Hotel for a long weekend most recently. We booked a Junior Suite on their own website (â‚¬ 120 / night) , given that other rooms seemed small (starting from â‚¬ 70). Supposedly we were upgraded to 'Deluxe Suite. Not a large room, but it did have a partial view of Marmara Sea, which was nice. Breakfasts are ok, nothing too fancy though. Orange Juice is YTL3.50 p/p. Interesting cellar, with Byzantine excavation exposed. Bathroom was refurbised, with (tuny and off placed) jacuzzi bath. Tired doors though, they need urgent replacement. Our room on 4th floor was under restaurant and roof terrace, and as there is another hotel directly right next door, there was late night noise when staff was clearing up. Great location, Grand Bazaar within 8 mins walk, Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace within 20 mins leisurely walk. Good many restaurants towards Blue Mosque. Better choices though on Taksim side (Istiklal Ave) of town. Close to tram no 38, going to either Taksim (via Kabatas & Funniculary; YTL 1.50 each), or Airport direction (via Zeyitinburu) Staff is friendly, though when an issue (like problems with heat or noise), little is done to assist (or claimed could be done) Main issues: Extreme heat in room, given 'it is winter'. Controls in room do no stop hot air from streaming in, so we had to ahve the windows open 24 hrs. As result, the noise in the back street, where the entrane of the rowdy terrace from the Baron Hotel is, caused much noise till very late. The ongoing truck deliveries, sometimes starying only at 11 pm, does not help either. We got little rest Overall ok, but probably can find better Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: London-Istanbul2010
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 22 coming from England and Iran to meet up in Istanbul. We have had a fantastic time at the Antik Hotel. Great modern hotel with all the facilities of a 4 star hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff especially Aksoy and Dona who have very good English language skills. They were excellent, very attentive, professional and competent. Everything was wonderful including room, breakfast, location and free internet access, free transfer as we stayed for 7 nights also the relationship between the rate and the quality. It was very close to the Bazaar district and shopping areas. Overall a great place, we had a great time and I would recommend this hotel to anyone who goes to Istanbul. Once we have the opportunity, we will definitely go back to Istanbul and we know where to stay now = Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel on a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Maravas
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in in 2006,2007 , 2008. 2009 and just in 2010. For we visited it for the 5th time it is because its splendid accomodation and location in the middle of Beyazit-Istanbul. Even more important is the good and friendly staff. Its a very good place for visiting the city - nearby the Grand Bazar and a tramway-stop -and off course for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for short break”
Reviews.Author: shehzad013
Reviews.Content: In the centre of Istanbul (Beyazit), a stone's throw from the main street. Tram just within 5 mins walk, Blue Mosque & Haghia Sophia within 15-20 mins walk. Nice hotel, room a bit small but very clean and comfy. I would recommend for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Cozy”
Reviews.Author: salibarania
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in commercial area. close to most of the attractions. The hotel's charectristic is its historic foundation & namely the Antik Cisterna. Staff was friendly & helpful.

Reviews.Title: “It's an amazing hotel in the center of an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: JohnAchkar
Reviews.Content: Very clean, 1 km to sutltanahmet, aya sophia and the Topkapi palace, 0.2 km to the nearest tramway station (Laleli or Beyazit), the staff is incredible, they help you with your tours..

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Om Palace - review”
Reviews.Author: Jumb02010 Posted by a Cleartrip traveler
Reviews.Content: Cons : Rooms were not very clean. Aircon was giving big sound. The Electricicty was not regular. Location was interior. Pros: Near to airport. O.K. for Single stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cosy hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kaliyaan
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews from TripAdvisor before I booked with the hotel. I found that the location was ideal as it was not central but at walking distance to the sights. The location of the hotel was in a quiet side street and although there was no view from the room, I found that the room was cleaned everyday!! If you're wanting luxury this is not the place, as I found it was good, clean, quiet and quite a modest hotel. The TV channels were mostly turkish but if your spending all day out and about, it doesnt really matter as you only cme back to rest and sleep. The breakfast had good variety of food but could have been improved with more crepes!! All in all this is definitely a hotel I would recommend as on a whole it did it for me :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect down-town location for family discovery of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Sablod
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family room on the first floor. Our window opened up to small terrace with flower pots, thus shielding us from the noisy city. We slept very well! The room was long, with two single beds at the entrance nwith a TV on the opposite wall (we put the kids there). Around the corner 9l-shaped room) we had a double bed (1.4 or 1.5m large), thus some porivacy within the same room, and our own TV. The bathroom was clean and comfortable, though nothing luxurious or so. The breakfast buffet was nice, with sufficient choice, without being sdumptuous. Coffee was good, but I missed my decaf. The kids loved the chocolate milk. Highly recommend to order the fresh orange juice; the small surcharge (rest of breakfast included) was well worth it. The staff was generally friendly. Main strength of the hotel is its central location, on a side street off Ordu Cd, where the main tram line passes. And that is a great way to get around, at a really good price. The grand bazaar is also close walking distance. All in all, this was a really solid home base for our 3 nights in Istanbul, and I warmly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Be cautious when paying the bill!”
Reviews.Author: LukaP
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in the Marmara suit which has a great view to the sea - even from the bed! The rooftop hotel restaurant is great and has a very nice view, but overall the hotel lost some glare from the photos on their website. Do not be disappointed! Services at the hotel are great - including the transfer from and to the airport. The only thing that was really annoying was the wi-fi internet connection that was obviously too bussy with other users and required logging in every few minutes or so... I would not go back to this hotel or recommend it to a friend because there are some quite nicer locations - for example in the vicinity of Haghia Sophia. Also I don't think there are much other rooms in the hotel that could be as nice as the Marmara Suit. If you choose to stay at this hotel be very cautious about the exchange rate when paying the bill! Room prices are stated in euros (EUR) and than converted to turkish lira (TRY) - which is also the currency that your credit card will be charged in. After my bank sent me a credit card bill I discovered that the hotel did not use the EUR/TRY exchange rate of the day I was paying the bill. They used a much different exchange rate from one week ago!!! Since all credit cards make a conversion with the exchange rate on the day of the transaction, my credit card bill was 40 EUR higher than the EUR amount stated on the invoice. As I inquired with the hotel manager, he told me that they use the exchange rate of the day of arrival! That is weird but not true in my case. I arrived on Monday evening and they used the exchange rate from past Friday when I payed when leaving next Saturday,,,, That is a really cheap trick to earn some additional money on exchange rates! After not being ripped off my entire stay in Istanbul, the hotel did it!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing really wrong with it”
Reviews.Author: Amsterdam41
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't call it a 'very good' hotel, but on the other hand it is better than average. They put us in a really tiny room the night we arrived (we had made a reservation) but after complaining we got a bigger room the second night. Cleaning staff was pretty noisy in the morning, now and then, but otherwise staff was helpful. Breakfast buffet was fine, a lot to choose from and the rooftop restaurant is a definite plus. As to the location: yes, it is close to all famous sightseeing spots, but on a second visit we would probably choose a hotel on the other side of the galata bridge, as this is a very nice neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when visiting Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: broozbeh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Antik hotel for 5 nights , out first time in Istanbul. What a great experience !, charming lobby and host, room we stayed was 112 and 412, very comfortable and roomy for two of us and clean and nice, but no view , Incredible staff , very accommodating and helpful. but cosy rooftop terrace restaurant had panoramic view of the Bosporus with included nice breakfast. Room included free high speed internet, but it would expire every two minutes, and need to re log-in. makes any meaningful internet use difficult. Close proximity to Grand Bazaar and walking distance to historic/cultural sites made Anitk hotel Ideal for our stay. We will come back , also recommend our friends and family to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Central, convenient, quiet, rooftop restaurant and extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: GES57
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a long weekend at this hotel. Its right near the tram station and in walking distance to the mosques etc but in a quieter side street. The rooms feel a little small but were very clean with all amenities for a pleasant stay. The top floor restaurants has tables to sit outside, the breakfast plentiful and we really enjoyed the special night at the Cisterne within the hotel. Best was the extremely helpful attitude of the staff when our flights were cancelled due to the volcanic ash.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: karin2004
Reviews.Content: we stayed here from saturday untill wednesday. rooms: a little bit small but nice decorated, good beds, bathroom very small but hot shower and most important: room and bathroom are clean. breakfast: i'll have to say extended turkish...that is to say: large choice of pastries, vegetables, cheese. yoghurt and jam & bread. a saw some people complaining, but for us it was perfect... so good choice for a holiday, a little out of town but easily walkable. take the tram T1 to universite en walk in direction of sultanahmet/

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: shropshirecrew
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in this Hotel for 3 nights. We had paid for a room upgrade and room on fourth floor was fairly large and bathroom good. Room situated by lift shaft which kept my partner awake for ages until put ipod on. Main problem we had was theft of 2 expensive items of clothing from the room. Reception say this is not possible, but it happened! We had to look clothes up in the case after that. This has never happened on a holiday before. Staff on reception did not handle this well, they answer phone whilst speaking to you. Had meal in restaurant first night, chips arrived 10 mins before the fish which came with a tiny salad. Service was a bit Fawlty Towers. Breakfast not great. Location good.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel to experience this city”
Reviews.Author: bermondseycouple
Reviews.Content: To be honest, it is not the same hotel without the staff who made our visit special last time we stayed in this hotel! We stayed here in March 2008 and the staff at the time were very friendly and helpful. The lobby barman particularly went out of his way to help us find or way around the city, and the restaurant manager was very welcoming. It is a shame these guys were not here this time. However the rooms are clean modern and comfortable and an all round nice hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a good place”
Reviews.Author: krendler
Reviews.Content: i and my family (my wife + 2 child) stay in Antik Hotel for 4 nights in a family room. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel (very quiet) stay very near to Beyazit and University bus stations, near Gran Bazar. Staff was very good. Breakfast was variuos every morning

Reviews.Title: “Do not go to Antik”
Reviews.Author: EvaZagreb
Reviews.Content: Even though I know that the most of Istanbul hotels do not have value for the stars Antik hotel has 4 stars and I wouldn't give it neither 2 stars. Do not belive in pictures, they are so fake...I came to see Istanbul and I love it, that was my purpose but I was totaly disapointed with the hotel. Room was 10-15 m2, and the breakfast was horrible so I didn't have brakefast for 5 days. Well one good thing has happened-I have discovered a new oppened hotel SKY KAMER Boutique HOTEL just oposite the Antik hotel and it's simply perfect.My boyfriend and I have booked a room to celebrate a New Years eve. The same price but just perfect, oppened a week ago and looks gorgeous. Location is the best to see everything important in Istanbull

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with central location, freindly staff, delicious food!”
Reviews.Author: FairyNicky
Reviews.Content: We visited Istanbul during May 2009 and styed at the Antik hotel. The rooms are very clean, staff is friendly and very helpful. The place of the hotel is near to a lot of landmarks, you need only to go out and to walk wihtout car/taxi/train. The breakfast is delicious and the view from the restaurant is great - sea view from the last floor of the hotel. Near the hotel i ssituated a public parking where you can park yuor car. We will sraty at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: PTOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights and the location was great as the hotel is very close to the main attractions but also in a fairly quite street away from the hussle and bussle. The staff were very friendly and helpful and made a stay in istanbul relaxing and enjoyable. Would definately recommend the Antik for anyone who want to be close to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, excellent food”
Reviews.Author: BUSINESSXX
Reviews.Content: For a business meeting I have been istanbul last week and spent 2 nights in the Hotel Antik. It was very clean, friendly and honest. Its staff was very helpfull, food was excellent. Next time I!ll stay in Antik again

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESTAURANT; GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: RASSY023
Reviews.Content: we have spent very nice 3 nights in the Antik Hotel. The Hotel was very characteristic first of all, you were informed about istanbul and its historical eras within a short trip inside, fantastic... Great restaurant with the roman byzantic and ottoman menus. Many thanks Antik Hotel and its friendly staff..

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel for independent travellers”
Reviews.Author: Nochka
Reviews.Content: Me and my Mom stayed in the hotel for four nights in October 2008. I booked the hotel using their web-site and the hotel offered free one-way transfer (either from or to the airport). We preferred to be met at the airport and brought into the hotel as we were having a late flight and it was our first time in Istanbul. The transfer service worked great, we were met and delivered to the hotel. The building is located at the back street which is not very clean, but it is just half-block away from the nice large street with banks, exchange offices and tram stop. It is close to Grand Bazaar and Beyazit Camii. It takes several tram stops to go to Sultanahmet and Galata Bridge. I guess, one can walk this distance as well, but I was with an elderly Mom and we usually took the tram. The room did not have any view - there was a wall of the neighboring building just half-meter away from the window; it did not bother us, as we just slept in the hotel. The room itself is small, but has all necessary things. The bathroom is VERY small, so big people may have trouble using it. The room was kept exceptionally clean though, the towels were changed daily. There were no bath robes, but were slippers. There were soap, shower gel and shampoo in the bathroom. However, sound proofing leaves much to be desired - we could hear voices and sounds of steps, etc. from the next room. Breakfasts were okay with good selection of food. Unfortunately, the front desk stuff was not really friendly. I tried to ask them how to get to some attractions and they were reluctant to answer and advise. Most frequently they just advised to take a taxi. Overall impression is quite good. The hotel is okay for an independent traveller who wants to have a clean place to take shower, sleep and does not stay in the hotel, but leaves right after breakfast and comes back just for sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel,worst location...”
Reviews.Author: lisa71Skp
Reviews.Content: I was with my son,and the trip was present for his 9 birthday...Evrything was good, exept the hotel.Very old,very dirty location.Also very noisy...Staf frendy,room clean...Breakfast simple...It is more like a 2 star hotel....

Reviews.Title: “extremely horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: rayan911
Reviews.Content: Simply it's tow stars , not four. Pictures at the site of the hotel is not as in the hotel. Accommodation here is very tired because of the inconvenience. Rooms very small. There is no air conditioning despite the heat. Breakfast dishes are numbered. The only good thing is the location but not great, and there are several hotels in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel at a perfect place in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Maravas
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel in in 2006,2007 and 2008. Also in 2009 we are going to visit this hotel because its splendid accomodation and location in the middle op Beyazit-Istanbul. Its a very good place for visiting the city and off coourse for shopping.

HotelInfo.Name: Antik Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Ordu Cad Sekbanbasi Sok No 10 | Beyazit, Istanbul 34490, Turkey
